subject: Philosophy
title: The Problem of Induction
description: A 60-second lesson on The Problem of Induction.

hook.text: The sun has risen every day of your life. Does that prove it will rise tomorrow? David Hume said no.

buildup.text: Induction means reasoning from past experience to future expectations. It's how we navigate daily life.

discovery.text: Hume showed there's no logical guarantee that the future will resemble the past. It's a habit, not a proof.

twist.text: Science depends entirely on induction. If induction isn't rational, is science rational?

climax.text: No one has solved Hume's problem. We use induction because it works â€” but we can't prove why it works.

punchline.text: The past can't prove the future. We just bet it will.

quiz.question: What is Hume's problem of induction?
options: Past experience can't logically guarantee future events
